qas.question: When did Smith change the party's rules?
Who replaced John Smith as leader?
Whose leadership eased tensions within the party?
When did Smith fail to change the party rules?
What did John Prescott successfully change?
What increased the influence of trade unions?

context: <b3_0>Kinnock<b3_0/> then resigned as leader and was replaced by <a0_0>John <b4_0>Smith<b4_0/><a0_0/>. Smith's leadership once again saw the re-emergence of tension between those on the party's left and those identified as "modernisers", both of whom advocated radical revisions of the party's stance albeit in different ways. At the <a1_0><b5_0>1993<b5_0/><a1_0/> conference, Smith successfully changed the <b6_0>party rules<b6_0/> and lessened the influence of the trade unions on the selection of candidates to stand for Parliament by introducing a <a2_0><b7_0>one member, one vote<a2_0/> system<b7_0/> called "OMOV" — but only barely, after a barnstorming speech by John Prescott which required Smith to compromise on other individual negotiations.
